title: Mount Mestas
text: Mount Mestas is a <a href="mountain">mountain</a> <a href="summit">summit</a> in the southeastern <a href="Sangre%20de%20Cristo%20Range">Sangre de Cristo Range</a> of the <a href="Rocky%20Mountains">Rocky Mountains</a> of <a href="North%20America">North America</a>. The peak is located southeast (<a href="Absolute%20bearing">bearing</a> 131°) of <a href="North%20La%20Veta%20Pass">North La Veta Pass</a> in <a href="Huerfano%20County%2C%20Colorado">Huerfano County</a>, <a href="Colorado">Colorado</a>, <a href="United%20States">United States</a>. The mountain was known as La Veta Peak until 1949 when it was renamed in honor of PFC Felix B. Mestas Jr. who was killed in action during the Second World War.
